articles.author: Richard Orange
articles.title: Anger in Sweden as elderly pay price for coronavirus strategy - The Guardian
articles.description: Staff with no masks or sanitiser fear for residents as hundreds die in care homes
articles.content:
It was just a few days after the ban on visits to his mothers nursing home in the Swedish city of Uppsala, on 3 April, that Magnus Bondesson started to get worried.
They [the home] opened up for Skype calls and thats when I saw two employees. I didnt see any… [+4696 chars]

articles.author: Jamieson Murphy
articles.title: COVID-19 tracking: Australian company has the tech ready to go - The Northern Daily Leader
articles.description: For almost a decade, United Network has been using its tech to track and alert Aussies who are in danger overseas. They say it could easily be used to trace the coronavirus.

articles.description: Confirmed cases on the Mid North Coast are at 51.
articles.content:
Confirmed cases on the Mid North Coast are 51 as of 8pm, April 18, according to NSW Health statistics.
There are now 29 cases in the Port Macquarie-Hastings local government area.
